title: Highest Percentage of Permanent Cropland
description: In 2022, 60% of Tuvalu's land area was dedicated to permanent cropland, the highest percentage in the world.

title: Most Dependent on Foreign Aid
description: Tuvalu received net official development assistance (ODA) amounting to 79.85% of its Gross National Income (GNI) in 2022, indicating a high dependency on foreign aid.

title: Highest ODA as a Percentage of Imports
description: In 2022, Tuvalu's net ODA was 110.18% of its imports of goods, services, and primary income, the highest globally, highlighting its reliance on external financial support.

title: Top ODA Received Per Capita
description: With a net ODA of $6,361.09 per capita in 2022, Tuvalu received the highest amount of aid per person in the world.

title: Low Nitrous Oxide Emissions
description: In 2023, Tuvalu reported minimal nitrous oxide emissions from industrial processes and waste, each at 0.0001 Mt CO2e, indicating a low environmental footprint.

title: Minimal Threatened Bird Species
description: As of 2018, Tuvalu had only one bird species classified as threatened, reflecting a relatively stable avian biodiversity.

title: High Dependency on Imports
description: In 2022, Tuvalu's imports of goods and services totaled $57,387,705, significantly outweighing its exports, which stood at $2,231,923.

title: Limited Access to Safe Drinking Water
description: In 2022, only 10.47% of Tuvalu's urban population had access to safely managed drinking water services, highlighting a critical public health challenge.

title: Small Population Size
description: Tuvalu's total population was recorded at 9,816 in 2023, making it one of the smallest countries by population globally.

title: Low Mobile Cellular Subscriptions
description: In 2021, Tuvalu had 9,000 mobile cellular subscriptions, indicating limited telecommunications infrastructure.

title: High Gross National Income (GNI)
description: In 2023, Tuvalu's GNI, using the Atlas method, was $86,040,855, reflecting a relatively strong economic position for its size.

title: Low Secondary Education Enrollment
description: In 2023, only 1,252 pupils were enrolled in secondary education, suggesting challenges in educational access and infrastructure.
